body.p: Mr. BUSH, from the joint committee appointed to visit the Institution for the Education of Idiots and Feeble-minded Children, reported the following bill, which was placed in the orders of the day, viz:
AN ACT to amend an act, entitled, "An act to establish an Institution for the Education of Idiots and Feeble-minded Children."

§1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,
2 That so much of the 7th section of the act to which this is an amendment, as
3 appropriates, for the support of each pupil, the sum of $125 per annum, be re-
4 pealed, and in lieu thereof, the sum of $150 for said purpose, as provided in
5 said act, be and the same is hereby appropriated for each pupil, payable as in
6 said act is provided.

§2. That for the purpose of paying off the debts of the institution, and fin-
2 ishing off the buildings, and furnishing the same with heating apparatus, and
3 providing furniture for same, and for building necessary inside fences, out-
4 houses, and cistern, the sum of fifteen thousand dollars is hereby appropriated,
5 to be paid out of the treasury, whenever the commissioners shall deem it neces-
6 sary, as is now provided by law.

§3. So much of the act of 11th February, 1860, to which this is an amend-
2 ment, or so much of any act heretofore enacted, as is inconsistent herewith, is
3 repealed.
§4. This act to take effect from its passage.

Feeble Minded Institute Report.
May 11 -- 1866
Wm. M D. Abbett
Supt.
